div.a: The Most Worthless Week In Tech

div.div: The case against the Consumer Electronics Show.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ure3wU&via=Digg&text=The Most Worthless Week In Tech

div.a: 50-Foot Mechanical Snake Brings Burning Man Vibe To CES

div.div: When you come to CES here, you expect to see computers and TVs galore. Mobile phones, sure. Printer and speakers? Check. But a 50-foot-long mechanical snake?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13ckUNO&via=Digg&text=50-Foot Mechanical Snake Brings Burning Man Vibe To CES

div.div: DO WE GO OVER A CLIFF?

div.a: This Is What Would Happen If We Break The Debt Ceiling

div.div: If Congress doesn't act, we could hit the debt ceiling anytime between February 15th and March 1st. If that happens, thing will get very bad, very quickly.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WoWcTe&via=Digg&text=This Is What Would Happen If We Break The Debt Ceiling

div.a: Why Is Google’s Eric Schmidt Going To North Korea?

div.div: As with so many things related to North Korea, there’s a lot of mystery surrounding this trip.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XftGGM&via=Digg&text=Why Is Google’s Eric Schmidt Going To North Korea?

div.a: How Much Is A Penny Worth In Business?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V5fMZ3&via=Digg&text=How Much Is A Penny Worth In Business?

div.a: The Original 'Star Wars' Trilogy As Maps

div.div: Philadelphia artist Andrew DeGraff has illustrated a series of maps that represents each film from the original "Star Wars" trilogy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/URR6lN&via=Digg&text=The Original 'Star Wars' Trilogy As Maps

div.a: The U.K's First Private Navy In 200 Years Will Fight Somali Pirates

div.div: The UK's first private navy in almost 200 years has been set up by a group of pioneering businessmen, former marines and retired captains and soldiers to defend shipping off the coast of east Africa from the threat of pirates.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UtobBX&via=Digg&text=The U.K's First Private Navy In 200 Years Will Fight Somali Pirates

div.div: According to the incident report, $300,000 worth of wire and four computers were missing from the building.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/109f2Gv&via=Digg&text=Thieves Strip Wire From 'Anchorman 2' Building

div.a: How Many Offensive Things Can You Count In This 'Doom' Mod?

div.div: Child murder, priest murder, Barney the dinosaur murder, Mario murder, Buddha murder...really, just murder murder; nothing is sacred.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VyEYov&via=Digg&text=How Many Offensive Things Can You Count In This 'Doom' Mod?

div.a: Al Roker: I Sharted Myself At The White House

div.div: When you undergo gastric bypass surgery, you can never be too careful about farting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/119c8Ro&via=Digg&text=Al Roker: I Sharted Myself At The White House

div.a: 'Snakes On A Plane' Director Dies Suddenly

div.div: David R. Ellis, the man who directed Snakes on a Plane, a film that helped change the relationship between movie studios and the internet in a big way, has died unexpectedly in Johannesburg, South Africa.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/109YNsU&via=Digg&text='Snakes On A Plane' Director Dies Suddenly

div.a: 43 Abortion Restrictions Were Passed In 2012, Second-Most Of All Time

div.div: With 43 abortion-restricting provisions enacted just last year, 2012 has been referred to as the second-worst year for abortion rights.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UEcKJn&via=Digg&text=43 Abortion Restrictions Were Passed In 2012, Second-Most Of All Time

div.div: OR THE SIGN OF A BUDDING CHEF

div.a: Apparently Concocting Weird Food Combos Is A Binge Eating Symptom

div.div: You know when you roll into a deli and think to yourself, Wouldn’t it be awesome if I put the chicken cutlet INSIDE the knish, then walk out thinking you’re a culinary genius? Well, according to some scientiests, it apparently just means you are a binge-eating fatso.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UDHoT0&via=Digg&text=Apparently Concocting Weird Food Combos Is A Binge Eating Symptom

div.div: On a Saturday night in the summer of 1998, an undercover officer logged in to a child-pornography chat room using the screen name Indy-Girl. Within minutes, a user named John introduced himself and asked her, “Are you into real life or just fantasy?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VO9s4N&via=Digg&text=The Science Of Sex Abuse

div.div: "The group is emulating the anti-gay marriage activists who made the Christian fast food chain Chick-fil-A into a national conservative cause with 'Chick-fil-A Appreciation Day.'"

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RCeWSW&via=Digg&text='Gun Appreciation Day' Planned Before Inauguration

div.div: REMEMBER TO LOOK OVER YOUR SHOULDER

div.a: Here's How To Skype Without Being Monitored

div.div: There’s been some concern lately of Skype communications being monitored without users’ consent, after the Microsoft-owned service began allowing law enforcement agencies to surveil text chats. Now a group of hackers have come up with an ingenious sub rosa method of communication on the service: hiding messages inside bits of digital silence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UDPL0S&via=Digg&text=Here's How To Skype Without Being Monitored

div.a: There Are 181K Social Media 'Gurus,' 'Ninjas,' Masters,' And 'Mavens' On Twitter

div.div: "Social media guru" takes up 17 of the 140 characters allowed in a Twitter bio, yet people choose to identify themselves as such.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VKoJ7l&via=Digg&text=There Are 181K Social Media 'Gurus,' 'Ninjas,' Masters,' And 'Mavens' On Twitter

div.div: TRICKS YOU WISH YOU KNEW IN MIDDLE SCHOOL

div.a: The Fastest Way To Chug A Bottle Of Water

div.div: Should you ever need to instantly inhale a bottle of water, this video will prove invaluable.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uzqo46&via=Digg&text=The Fastest Way To Chug A Bottle Of Water

div.div: The Mall of Louisiana was evacuated Saturday night after a flash mob turned into an ugly brawl.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wmr9ry&via=Digg&text=Ugly Flash Mob Empties Mall

div.a: Massive Solar Eruption Captured By NASA

div.div: Watch this footage provided by NASA of a massive solar eruption emitted by the sun on Dec. 31, 2012.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uz0Twb&via=Digg&text=Massive Solar Eruption Captured By NASA

div.a: IDEO Founder Talks About Steve Jobs And 'Design Thinking' In '60 Minutes'

div.div: IDEO founder David Kelley sat down with 60 Minutes this week to discuss the philosophy behind "design thinking" — an innovative approach that melds product design with human behavior.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RAMQrb&via=Digg&text=IDEO Founder Talks About Steve Jobs And 'Design Thinking' In '60 Minutes'

div.a: 'It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia' Beer Coming To Stores

div.div: Fresh off the finale of its 12-year Vertical Epic series, California’s Stone Brewing Co. has announced its first collaboration beer of 2013, and it is a fun one for fans of the TV show "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VCL8ng&via=Digg&text='It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia' Beer Coming To Stores

div.div: In Japan, McDonald's is mucking things up with a special promotion. Called "Enjoy! 60 Second Service", the concept is that if you don't get your order in sixty seconds, it's free. The problem is, that's just not enough time to assemble a burger. Here's the visual proof.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13deLAb&via=Digg&text=A Gallery Of Hamburger Horrors

div.a: In Apple’s War On Taxes, Surrender Costs $28 Billion

div.div: With the U.S. Senate reportedly finishing an investigation into how Apple and others dodge taxes, and with Apple fighting for an officially sanctioned tax holiday, it’s worth taking stock of Apple’s tax liabilities.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WnscqY&via=Digg&text=In Apple’s War On Taxes, Surrender Costs $28 Billion

div.div: AN EXPEDITION INTO THE DARK HEART OF CES

div.a: The Future Is Now, The Future Is Weird

div.div: In a world where everyone’s mom has an iPhone, how is technology supposed to feel futuristic?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RBTmhr&via=Digg&text=The Future Is Now, The Future Is Weird

div.div: Over at the Consumer Electronics Show in Vegas, Chinese computer-maker Lenovo is about to introduce something ridiculous.It's called the Horizon. It's a 27-inch, 17 pound, $1,700 "table PC."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VKdzQa&via=Digg&text=The Weirdest Thing From CES

div.a: Why 'Right Now' Should Be Psy's Next Single

div.div: Psy's fans in Asia are hoping “Right Now” will debut as a single in the United States. This is why Americans should get on board.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TFh1x3&via=Digg&text=Why 'Right Now' Should Be Psy's Next Single

div.div: WHAT ABOUT TWO ZERO ONE THREE? NO?

div.a: Twenty Thirteen Or Two Thousand Thirteen?

div.div: With any luck, 2013 will be the year we get over our post-millennial awkwardness about how to say what year it is.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VDERdx&via=Digg&text=Twenty Thirteen Or Two Thousand Thirteen?

div.a: What Happens When You Drop A Red Hot Nickel Ball In Water?

div.div: Ever wonder how people come up with new sound effects? They do stuff like this.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UqrvOm&via=Digg&text=What Happens When You Drop A Red Hot Nickel Ball In Water?

div.div: BUT YOU STILL HAVE TO WAIT ON LINE

div.a: How Disney Parks Plan To Track Every Move You Make

div.div: Imagine Walt Disney World with no entry turnstiles. Cash? Passé: Visitors would wear rubber bracelets encoded with credit card information, snapping up corn dogs and Mickey Mouse ears with a tap of the wrist. Now stop fantasizing: this is the new reality.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VNQXNS&via=Digg&text=How Disney Parks Plan To Track Every Move You Make

div.a: Elusive Giant Squid Caught On Film

div.div: Scientists and broadcasters said Monday they have captured footage of an elusive giant squid roaming the depths of the Pacific Ocean, showing it in its natural habitat for the first time ever.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XClGnb&via=Digg&text=Elusive Giant Squid Caught On Film
